file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-62-03-04 - (145) FMS (UNIVERSAL) CONFIGURATION MODULE / (135) DUAL FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (145) FMS (UNIVERSAL) CONFIGURATION MODULE / (135) DUAL FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the FMS configuration module. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH FMS DUAL FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE - 34-62-03-000-803-A UNIVERSAL REMOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH FMS DUAL FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE - 34-62-03-400-803-A UNIVERSAL INSTALLATION AIRCRAFT WITH FMS SINGLE FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE 34-62-03-000-804-A UNIVERSAL - REMOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH FMS SINGLE FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE 34-62-03-400-804-A UNIVERSAL - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-62-03 Page 1 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-62-03-000-803-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL 2. DUAL FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE - REMOVAL A. General This task gives the procedures to remove the dual FMS1(2) configuration module. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 23-22-01-000-801-A/400 ACARS UNIT - REMOVAL HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-21-01-000-801-A/400 AHRS COMPUTER - REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-62-01-000-801-A/400 - S.B.145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 214 113CZ Forward Electronic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY M81969/14-1 Inserter / Extractor Pin insert / extract E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the Task Forward Electronic Compartment EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-803-A/400 34-62-03 Page 2 of 13 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) For aircraft PRE MOD S.B.145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (2) For aircraft POS MOD S.B.145-32-0036, install safety pin of the NLG doors solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) Open the 113CZ access door (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (4) On the circuit breaker panel, located on the cockpit ceiling, open the circuit breakers bellow and attach a DO NOT CLOSE tags to them: (a) FMS1 (Location Tip: DC BUS 1/NAV/FMS1) or FMS2 (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/NAV/FMS2) related to the module that will be removed. (b) AHRS1 (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 1/NAV/AHRS1) or AHRS2 (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/NAV/AHRS2) related to the module that will be removed. J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the AHRS computer (AMM TASK 34-21-01-000-801-A/400). (2) Remove the ACARS unit only if you will remove the FMS2 configuration module ( AMM TASK 23-22-01-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove the FMS computer from the mounting tray (1) (AMM TASK 34-62-01-000-801- A/400). (4) Remove the screws that attach the electrical connector (7) to the mounting tray (1). (5) Remove the screws (6) that attach the mounting tray (1) to the structure. (6) Carefully pull and turn the mounting tray (1) to get access to the configuration module (3). (7) Remove the nuts (4) from the screws (2) to remove the configuration module (3). (8) Use the Pin extractor to remove the configuration module (3) pins from the electrical connector middle plug (5). (9) Remove the configuration module (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-803-A/400 34-62-03 Page 3 of 13 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

A 4 7 6 145AMM340297.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-803-A/400 34-62-03 Page 5 of 13 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-62-03-400-803-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL 3. DUAL FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE - INSTALLATION A. General This section gives the procedures to install the dual FMS configuration module. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 23-22-01-000-801-A/400 ACARS UNIT - REMOVAL SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400 AHRS COMPUTER - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 34-62-01-400-801-A/400 - DUAL FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE - PROGRAM- AMM TASK 34-62-03-400-801-A/200 MING S.B.145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 214 113CZ Forward Electronic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY M81969/14-1 Inserter / Extractor Pin insert / extract E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the Task Forward Electronic Compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A NOTE: The configuration module green and the white wires are not used. They must be isolated. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-803-A/400 34-62-03 Page 6 of 13 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Use the Pin inserter to insert the configuration module pins in the electrical connector middle plug (5), as shown in the table below. Table 401 CABLE COLOR MIDDLE PLUG PIN Brown 14G Red 14H Yellow 14J Blue 14K (2) Install the configuration module (3) on the mounting tray (1). (3) Tighten the nuts (4) that attach the configuration module (3) to the mounting tray (1). (4) Tighten the screws that attach the electrical connector (7) to the mounting tray (1). (5) Tighten the screws (6) that attach the mounting tray (1) to the structure. (6) Install the ACARS unit if you removed it ( AMM TASK 23-22-01-000-801-A/400). (7) Install the FMS computer into the mounting tray (1) (AMM TASK 34-62-01-400-801-A/ 400). (8) Install the AHRS into the mounting tray (1) ( AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the 113CZ access door (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) For aircraft POS MOD S.B.145-32-0036, remove safety pin of the NLG doors solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) On the circuit breaker panel, located on the cockpit ceiling, close the FMS and AHRS circuit breakers and remove a DO NOT CLOSE tags from them. (4) Do the programming of the dual FMS configuration module ( AMM TASK 34-62-03-400-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-803-A/400 34-62-03 Page 7 of 13 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-62-03-000-804-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL 4. SINGLE FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE - REMOVAL A. General This task gives the procedures to remove the FMS configuration module. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-21-01-000-801-A/400 AHRS COMPUTER - REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-62-01-000-802-A/400 SINGLE FMS COMPUTER - REMOVAL S.B.145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 214 113CZ Forward electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY M81969/14-1 Inserter/Extractor To insert and remove the pin E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) For aircraft PRE-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-804-A/400 34-62-03 Page 8 of 13 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) For aircraft POST-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, install safety pin of the NLG doors solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) Open access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (4) On the circuit breaker panel, located on the cockpit ceiling, open the circuit breakers bellow and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tags to them: (a) FMS1 (Location Tip: DC BUS 1/NAV/FMS1). (b) AHRS1 (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 1/NAV/AHRS1). J. Removal (Figure 403) (Figure 404) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Remove the AHRS computer (AMM TASK 34-21-01-000-801-A/400). (2) Remove the FMS computer from the mounting tray (1) ( AMM TASK 34-62-01-000-802-A/400). (3) Remove the screws that attach the electrical connector (2) to the mounting tray (1). (4) Remove the screws (7) that attach the mounting tray (1) to the structure. (5) Carefully pull and turn the mounting tray (1) to get access to the configuration module (5). (6) Remove the nuts (6) from the screws (4) to remove the configuration module (5). (7) Use the Pin extractor to remove the configuration module (5) pins from the electrical connector middle plug (3). (8) Remove the configuration module (5). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-804-A/400 34-62-03 Page 9 of 13 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: CONFIGURATION MODULE AT MOUNTING TRAY TOP Single FMS Configuration Module - Removal/Installation Figure 403 A 4 5 1 7 6 3 DET. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-62-03-400-804-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL 5. SINGLE FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE - INSTALLATION A. General This section gives the procedures to install the FMS configuration module. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400 AHRS COMPUTER - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 34-62-01-400-802-A/400 SINGLE FMS COMPUTER - INSTALLATION SINGLE FMS CONFIGURATION MODULE - PRO- AMM TASK 34-62-03-400-802-A/200 GRAMMING S.B.145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 214 113CZ Forward electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY M81969/14-1 Inserter/Extractor To insert and remove the pin E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 403) (Figure 404) SUBTASK 420-003-A NOTE: The configuration module green and white wires are not used. They must be isolated. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-804-A/400 34-62-03 Page 12 of 13 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Use the Pin inserter to insert the configuration module pins in the electrical connector middle plug (5), as shown in the table below. Table 402 CABLE COLOR MIDDLE PLUG PIN Brown 14G Red 14H Yellow 14J Blue 14K (2) Install the configuration module (5) on the mounting tray (1). (3) Tighten the nuts (6) that attach the configuration module (5) to the mounting tray (1). (4) Tighten the screws that attach the electrical connector (2) to the mounting tray (1). (5) Tighten the screws (7) that attach the mounting tray (1) to the structure. (6) Install the FMS computer into the mounting tray (1) ( AMM TASK 34-62-01-400-802-A/ 400). (7) Install the AHRS into the mounting tray ( AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Close access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) For aircraft POST-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, remove safety pin of the NLG doors solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) On the circuit breaker panel, located on the cockpit ceiling, close the circuit breakers bellow and remove DO NOT CLOSE tags from them: (a) FMS1 (Location Tip: DC BUS 1/NAV/FMS1). (b) AHRS1 (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 1/NAV/AHRS1). (4) Do the programming of the Single FMS configuration module ( AMM TASK 34-62-03-400-802-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-804-A/400 34-62-03 Page 13 of 13 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
